Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2012 08:52PM Bonseye wrote: When i was diagnosed with my Breast Cancer and had my chest, abdomen and pelvis CT i was told despite the MRI sizing my tumor at 4-6 cm luckily it was only 3cm) They told me looking at the CT of my Chest they couldn't see the cancer. Mine did not image on my Mammogram-10% of cancers, Lobular, do not image, Didn't show on my ultrasound either. My radiation oncologist couldn't figure out how iI found it, I had pain,..felt that it was different and after losing a friend to BC that had pain called my Breast Navigator that got me in right away. I had a biopsy the next day and the following day found out I had cancer. I had three positive nodes, only small amounts...but enough i needed chemo and radiation. Good thing I followed my heart and went to the doctor....I hate to think where I would be at this time had i ignored my pain. Even when i had the biopsy the doctor said the tissue was not a concern. Turned out it was....he was in total shock! Thank God for him listening and believing in me that I knew something was wrong. I am not an alarmist but knew the sharp stabbing pain was a concern. I need to be able to give back and help others understand the need to listen to their bodies. No need to panic,.,have mammograms for sure but if something is different-follow your heart. My husband and I try not to think too much about the "what if" I had ignored this...take a breath and get a recommendation for a good breast surgeon-GP's are not informed enough from my experience. A Second Opinion from another Breast Surgeon may put your mind at ease. I got two opinions for every step of this journey. Please don't panic as implants do have complications and being pregnant takes a toll on the body.....keep us up to date
Posts.Title: would a chest CT pick up breast cancer? merrysee merrysee

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2011 08:39AM Bonseye wrote: I haven't had short hair in years so I will have to figure out this as I go along.....I don't want my head to be itchy so I am going to rock scarfs and make it my own. I heard someone say once and I always remember it.....It doesn't matter what others think of us....my friend went through this a few years ago and loved being bald and made friends at chemo.....just going to take this journey one step at a time...told my daughter I may die my hair pink-LOL. she just laughed. Not sure if I will be brave enough...time will tell.....

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2012 08:36PM Bonseye wrote: Love having you all here! Ossa-love your hair and hoping mine grows in as fast!! You look great! Saw a neighbor the other day and I told her I had 5 more treatments to go......her response "That went fast!". To which i didn't hesitate to say. "No it didn't"!!! All i could think of was all the SE's...hair loss, no eyebrows, eyelashes, appetite...pain, shingles, emergency surgery for staph infection....what are people thinking?? I have done well losing my hair and dealing in general...not all women would do as well as all of us! The little things are exciting to me right now.....starting treatment 8 of Taxol and watching my head carefully for hair growth...feel like a Chia Pet! LOL. I had incredible hair before this and just thankful to think of it growing back....I will take what I get-it sure beats bald. :)

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 09:08PM Bonseye wrote: Peachypie-Your hair looks awesome!!  I am excited now to be done with chemo...my hair started growing in around my 7th Taxol.  It is really getting thick now.  It was really grey and it starting to darken up.  My DH loves to rub my head....I go topless at home in front of almost anyone....I am who I am and this is what it is.....it does get chilly at times so I will put a hoodie on for warmth...I find the scarves and wig annoy my hair growing in...very prickly.  Since Taxol...I have 4 eyebrow hairs on the right and one on the left.  I am going to get my eyebrows tatooed on.  All the nurses at chemo have had it done and they look awesome.  The hair will grow in over it and any that don't will get plucked.  My eyelashes are all missing and I look forward to those growing....hate when there is a lot of wind!  so much dirt a flyin'

Posts.Title: For everyone about to start chemo Trisha-Anne Bonseye

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2013 10:09PM Bonseye wrote: Hi Everyone, I am new to this thread. I finished my cancer treatment in July only to have a massive infection in my arm-up and across my chest. This has been a major set back for me. For some reason in December I had a 102+ fever and spent 5 days in the hospital on IV antibiotics and just 8 weeks later (two weeks ago) I had it hit me hard again.I spent another 5 days in the hospital. No one can figure out where this came from. I am so very careful, electric razor, hand sanitizer......I have 5 amazing doctors very perplexed. This last infection has left my arm still red (after 2 weeks on oral meds) and they have me on oral antibiotics for a full month since this happened so fast again.  Today I picked up my sleeve that was ordered for me.  I got a Juzo sleeve and am waiting for my guantlet to come in.  I put it on in the store and the women who runs the medical supply part was so helpful.  When we got it on properly my arm almost felt "cold". I wore it for 5 hours. I couldn't take it any more so I removed it and my arm is killing me.  I had a Lymphedema PT specialist that measured me. I know that she said it would be really tight but once the fluid goes down it will be a bit more comfortable.  I am guessing this is "normal"  but I did feel my arm also was a bit more red after removing the sleeve.  Just another torture to endure.  I am so trying to deal but after 17 long months, this is so painful.  Any advice to survive the "break in" period?
Posts.Title: ALL THINGS Gloves and sleeves purple32 tsoebbin

Posts.Title: Embarassing question.... Emaline jocelynlally

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 06:18AM Bonseye wrote: I am going for a consult next week....I was told that with three nodes with "micro" mets I may not need radiation. The last patient that was sent with less then four nodes didn't need radiation. I soooo don't want it as i need to have a re-construction of my right side that had a staph infection. They took out my expander and if I need radiation then they have to use my back muscle to reconstruct that side. I am physically in pain from rheumatoid arthritis and need an easier road. As it is now I wake up with such bad back spasms. I feel like I will live on pain meds. At this rate will my life be pain free? ! I am trying to stay opened minded and if I need it...then i need it...we shall see what this next chapter will bring. I have a glimmer of hope and am holding on to it with the belief that there is always a chance. I feel like they removed everything (bilateral mastectomy and nodes removed) and having chemo....what are they radiating? Just curious....there are side effects with that too. Can't wait to ask. One of my opinions is Sloan Kettering one of the leading Cancer Institutes in the US. Based out of NYC they have a satellite 6 minutes from my house here in NJ. Trying to not get ahead of my self....small steps.......
